intro: Lomaria aurata, commonly known as the golden lomaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Its most striking feature is its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Lomaria aurata is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or grasslands.
